benchmark_details.name: EVA-SCORE (Extraction-and-Validation Score)
benchmark_details.overview: EVA-SCORE is a new evaluation metric for assessing the informativeness of abstractive long-form summarization by extracting atomic facts from candidate and reference summaries, identifying overlap, and validating information using LLMs.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide an objective and quantitative analysis for evaluating the informativeness of long-form summaries.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: EVA-SCORE is time-consuming to run and primarily focuses only on informativeness.

data.source: Datasets used include CNN DailyMail, PubMed, GovReport, arXiv, and BookSum for testing EVA-SCORE.
data.annotation: Manual annotation by five expert annotators for the evaluation process.

methodology.calculation: EVA-SCORE is defined as the harmonic mean of Precision and Recall.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better alignment with human judgments.
methodology.baseline_results: EVA-SCORE shows the highest correlations with human evaluations compared to traditional metrics like ROUGE and BERTScore.
methodology.validation: Validation through multiple annotators to ensure reliability.
